remarks: Ceva's theorem first lemma.  Multiplies three identities and divides by the common factors.  (Contributed by Saveliy Skresanov, 24-Sep-2017.)
statement:
cevathlem1.a $e |- ( ph -> ( A e. CC /\ B e. CC /\ C e. CC ) ) $.
cevathlem1.b $e |- ( ph -> ( D e. CC /\ E e. CC /\ F e. CC ) ) $.
cevathlem1.c $e |- ( ph -> ( G e. CC /\ H e. CC /\ K e. CC ) ) $.
cevathlem1.d $e |- ( ph -> ( A =/= 0 /\ E =/= 0 /\ C =/= 0 ) ) $.
cevathlem1.e $e |- ( ph -> ( ( A x. B ) = ( C x. D ) /\ ( E x. F ) = ( A x. G ) /\ ( C x. H ) = ( E x. K ) ) ) $.
cevathlem1 $p |- ( ph -> ( ( B x. F ) x. H ) = ( ( D x. G ) x. K ) ) $.
